channel.title: The New York Times Trends
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title: The police chief who oversaw the response to a mass shooting in Uvalde, Texas, arrived on scene without his police radio, a law enforcement official said. A tactical team ultimately ignored directives not to breach the classroom. https://t.co/oxClOIGg1c

A former Air Force sergeant who participated online in an extremist anti-government movement was sentenced to 41 years in prison for murdering a federal security officer and injuring another outside a courthouse in Oakland, California. https://t.co/8Yq2O1yKOs

“We value the comfort and self-regard of men, especially famous ones, more than we value the safety and dignity of women, even famous ones,” our critic writes on the Johnny Depp-Amber Heard trial verdict. https://t.co/tNWFewWQBJ

An emergency services dispatcher in Buffalo who was accused of hanging up on a 911 call from a supermarket employee during the mass shooting in May has been fired. The employee said the dispatcher yelled at her for whispering as she hid during the attack. https://t.co/ytiXrh11cY

President Emmanuel Macron of France, who has sought to position himself as the world’s chief negotiator with the Kremlin, pleaded Saturday to not "humiliate" Russia.
Ukraine’s foreign minister said Macron's advice "can only humiliate France." https://t.co/DWbIoZdhkI

Dozens of mariachi musicians had traveled to Uvalde with the hope that they could deliver a dose of comfort. With trumpets, strings and serenades, their music speaks to a community’s profound sorrow. https://t.co/aefNYCmhbm https://t.co/N2Ay5XaKt7
Drivers in Miami faced slashing rains and flooded streets as a rapidly growing weather system moved into the South Florida region. https://t.co/zMSiS73aLq https://t.co/IURSembeBz

If ever there was a potent symbol of how much Russia’s invasion of Ukraine has altered Europe, the sight of this enormous battleship in Stockholm, bristling with 26 warplanes and 2,400 Marines and sailors, would certainly be it. https://t.co/VKf2iDHQjC https://t.co/sRMB3lyxpA

If four key gun control proposals now being considered in Congress had been law since the Columbine High School in 1999, they might have changed the course of 35 mass shootings that killed 446, a New York Times analysis found. https://t.co/DQEllQAcfi

A 150-mile leisurely bike ride from Trieste, Italy, through Slovenia, to the ancient city of Pula, Croatia, brims with ancient traditions, sublime food and perched-village photo ops. https://t.co/xB4y3iVKMZ https://t.co/fR4IndCwIy

Raquel Fortun is one of only two forensic pathologists in the Philippines. Before her, there had been no independent inquiry into the country's drug war. She has used her skills to show how other doctors falsely claimed some victims died natural deaths. https://t.co/ySiccf2z0V https://t.co/3qIp1F0KtJ

Special Olympics lifted its Covid vaccine requirement for athletes and staff after Florida officials threatened a $27.5 million fine over the mandate. Gov. Ron DeSantis, who has blocked vaccine and mask mandates, criticized the requirement on Friday. https://t.co/u6sBybMQJc
Breaking News: The Justice Department declined to charge Mark Meadows and Dan Scavino, two former Trump aides, for stonewalling the Jan. 6 inquiry. https://t.co/EWblVEZLli

Dozens of mariachi musicians had traveled to Uvalde with the hope that they could deliver a dose of comfort. With trumpets, strings and serenades, their music speaks to a community’s profound sorrow. https://t.co/m9iO3mpZ8f https://t.co/X2lju8kcPd

Having something to look forward to can boost your mood and lower your stress, studies suggest. Whether it's something small or large, like trying a new book or planning a trip, here are ways to incorporate the power of anticipation into everyday life. https://t.co/lsaPt7uh7Y

Zaila Avant-garde was 14 last year when she became the first Black American to win the Scripps National Spelling Bee. Her ambitions do not stop there. She wants to play for the WNBA, work at NASA and develop a way for humans to survive longer in space. https://t.co/XBoTSvwZX9 https://t.co/kFZsi5XZjs

The amount of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere broke a record in May, scientists said on Friday. Humans pumped 36 billion tons of the planet-warming gas into the atmosphere in 2021, more than in any previous year. https://t.co/3epCfNwl3z https://t.co/gstZUXSUd0

After mass shootings in the U.S., proposals to ban assault weapons follow. And gunmakers respond — by adapting guns in ways that keep them legal, but nearly indistinguishable from illegal assault weapons. https://t.co/0hyD4um6CW
Barack Obama paid tribute to Queen Elizabeth II in a video message in which he said they had formed their own “special relationship.” https://t.co/eAqQqgn0Qm https://t.co/0LIP3q2phX
Carbon dioxide in the atmosphere hit its highest level ever as humans pumped 36 billion tons of the planet-warming gas in 2021. https://t.co/8IfPjsxO8P

Representative Chris Jacobs, a Republican from New York, embraced gun control measures after the shootings in Buffalo and Uvalde, Texas. A week later, facing his party’s anger, he’s ending his re-election run. https://t.co/N6bypC4Tmd
Breaking News: Peter Navarro, a White House adviser to Donald Trump, was charged with contempt of Congress for defying a subpoena from the Jan. 6 inquiry. https://t.co/sLYPtgRgDG

Tosca Musk, Elon Musk’s younger sister, is the force behind Passionflix, a streaming service dedicated to adaptations of romance novels and erotic fan fiction. The online service costs $6 a month and organizes content by a “barometer of naughtiness.” https://t.co/nAx8KBaA5r
Breaking News: The U.S. hiring spree continued in May: Employers added 390,000 jobs and average hourly earnings rose 5.2% from a year ago. https://t.co/gj7PFTSYf2

Breaking News: The police chief who oversaw the response to a mass shooting in Uvalde, Texas, arrived on scene without his police radio, a law enforcement official said. A tactical team ultimately ignored directives not to breach the classroom. https://t.co/sShSGMqXxG

Barbados dropped Queen Elizabeth II as its head of state and became a republic. Now, six other Caribbean nations may follow. Since the Black Lives Matter movement, calls for reparations for Britain’s brutal role in the slave trade have been rising. https://t.co/X0lvWxxODW

Breaking News: A day before the Jan. 6 assault on the Capitol, an aide to Mike Pence warned of a security risk to the vice president, saying President Donald Trump was going to publicly turn on him. https://t.co/5UGbG0bJi3

Breaking News: Harini Logan, 14, won the 2022 Scripps National #SpellingBee after the competition headed to an unprecedented spell-off. She correctly spelled 21 words in 90 seconds. https://t.co/6cPy9YNee5

Prince Harry and his wife, Meghan, are expected to make their first big appearance at Queen Elizabeth II's #PlatinumJubilee.
They will attend a service at St. Paul’s Cathedral, but the queen herself will skip the event. Follow live. https://t.co/LeusTsxQqq

Johnny Depp’s victory against Amber Heard — when he was awarded more than $10 million in damages — could embolden others accused of abuse or misconduct to try their luck with juries, lawyers say. https://t.co/7JA4I8ChSD

Prince Harry and his wife, Meghan, walked hand-in-hand into St. Paul’s Cathedral, drawing loud cheers from the crowd outside and turning every head inside.
In the #PlatinumJubilee's meticulous choreography, their highly visible arrival was no accident. https://t.co/BjIlyltqKX https://t.co/5rSSdINpn1

It was a moment that royal watchers had been waiting for.
Prince Harry and his wife, Meghan, made their first appearance at the #PlatinumJubilee. The prince surrendered his senior royal status in 2020 when the couple left Britain to live in California. https://t.co/eXwFs6vNey https://t.co/f1NaCmGFAT

Prince Harry and his wife, Meghan, have arrived for the service at St. Paul’s Cathedral, their first public appearance during the queen's #PlatinumJubilee celebrations.
Watch live. https://t.co/eSGV3X15Mn https://t.co/Tvgsb1Ney1

Florida’s Supreme Court refused to consider a challenge to a new voting map approved by the Republican State Legislature that a lower court said illegally diluted the power of Black voters. https://t.co/yPl9PmorIy

Harini Logan, 14, won the Scripps National #SpellingBee, claiming victory in a blistering, first-of-its-kind spell-off that capped a marathon duel. The eighth-grader from San Antonio, Texas, was reinstated earlier in the final round. https://t.co/G3j9QFgQUQ https://t.co/UCY0g2ICKp

Queen Elizabeth II celebrated 70 years on the throne Thursday, as the first day of the Platinum Jubilee celebrations kicked off in London. The festivities included a military parade, a 41-gun salute and a 70-aircraft flyover. https://t.co/HOWsRNQmJp

“This is not about taking away anyone’s guns,” President Biden said in a speech calling on Congress to pass new federal gun legislation, including stopping the sale of assault-style weapons, expanding background checks and passing “red flag” laws. https://t.co/lW6DP428ML https://t.co/C400givGlO

At least a half-dozen current and former Proud Boys, the far-right nationalist group that was at the forefront of Jan. 6 Capitol riot, have secured seats on the Miami-Dade Republican Executive Committee, seeking to influence local politics from the inside. https://t.co/O7lyLahPur

Zaila Avant-garde was 14 last year when she became the first Black American to win the Scripps National Spelling Bee. Her ambitions do not stop there. She wants to play for the WNBA, work at NASA and develop a way for humans to survive longer in space. https://t.co/b1k5h3ym5s https://t.co/hu3euykPGW
Breaking News: New York lawmakers passed a set of gun bills to raise the minimum age to buy a semiautomatic rifle to 21 and revise the state’s “red flag” laws. https://t.co/0ZIxXejuXX

Glittery butterflies. TikTok. Superman. Encanto. These are just a few of the details that families of the victims of the Uvalde mass shooting provided about their children to the team creating customized caskets for their funeral services. https://t.co/gkIUN2Y3TY https://t.co/maNlcjase2
Breaking News: In a speech, President Biden urged Congress to ban assault-style weapons, expand background checks and pass “red flag” laws. https://t.co/jzZ8Q3Tfvt https://t.co/mJ6zqFAXvA

The gunman who killed four people at a Tulsa medical building underwent back surgery last month and the doctor who performed it was one of the victims, police said. His weapons included an AR-15-style rifle he bought hours before the attack. https://t.co/IoqGq6jHjL https://t.co/byUy3Sk2sd

“We value the comfort and self-regard of men, especially famous ones, more than we value the safety and dignity of women, even famous ones,” our critic @aoscott writes on the Johnny Depp-Amber Heard trial verdict. https://t.co/EOt3nrQCKr

After he heard two loud noises he recognized as gunfire, Gannon Gill, a physician assistant, led his patient to safety at the Tulsa medical center that was the site of a mass shooting. https://t.co/sHhCA81Bst
Breaking News: President Biden plans to travel to Saudi Arabia this month to rebuild relations in an effort to lower gas prices in the U.S. and isolate Russia. https://t.co/N2roZNSZbS

Doctors successfully transplanted a 3-D printed ear made of living human cells. The new ear, transplanted in March, will continue to regenerate cartilage tissue, giving it the look and feel of a natural ear, said the biotech company that made the implant. https://t.co/gCmmBnOsKF https://t.co/DZbke2sNUN

Having something to look forward to can boost your mood and lower your stress, studies suggest. Whether it's something small or large, like trying a new book or planning a trip, here are ways to incorporate the power of anticipation into everyday life. https://t.co/53fSJN7WaT

Breaking News: The gunman who killed four people at a Tulsa medical building underwent back surgery last month and the doctor who performed it was one of the victims, police said. His weapons included an AR-15-style rifle he bought hours before the attack. https://t.co/lddrAIQxdj

The U.S. will send Ukraine advanced rocket systems and munitions as part of a new $700 million package of military aid intended to help Ukrainians fight back against Russia, President Biden said on Tuesday. https://t.co/Sjvc44IRsp
